programme.title: The Barbie Story
programme.desc: A documentary about the origins of Barbie and her worldwide impact.

programme.title: Britney Spears: Unbreakable
programme.desc: Look into the glamorous and tumultuous life of pop sensation Britney Spears. From her incredible skyrocketing ascent into stardom to her personal troubles and downfalls, see the inside of the star's life with exclusive interviews. This is the story of Britney Spears- Unbreakable.

programme.title: Taylor Swift: Superstar
programme.desc: Taylor Swift completed her transition from country star to pop superstar. With exclusive interviews and footage, discover the remarkable story of the most powerful woman in Pop.

programme.title: Beyonce: Queen B
programme.desc: One of the most recognizable figures in contemporary music. Get lost in the ultimate story of modern day superstardom as we take you through the incredible journey of Beyoncé.

programme.title: All Man: The International Male Story
programme.desc: All Man: The International Male Story tells the remarkable journey of how an unlikely band of outsiders designed one of the most sought-after mail-order catalogs of the 70s and 80s. International Male's lasting impact on fashion and masculinity would forever change the way men look at themselves, at each other, and how the world would look at them.

programme.title: Cosplay Universe
programme.desc: Cosplay Universe explores the rise and evolution of the global Comic Con sub-culture through the eyes of the world's top cosplayers. The film taps into the psychology behind this art of self expression and shows how it has transformed people and helped them find community. The film stars cosplay superstar Yaya Han and features one of the last interviews by comic book legend Stan Lee.

programme.title: Feels Good Man
programme.desc: When Pepe the Frog becomes an unwitting icon of hate, his creator fights to bring Pepe back from the darkness.

programme.title: Being BeBe: The BeBe Zahara Benet Documentary
programme.desc: Being BeBe intimately charts 15 years-in-the-life of drag performer BeBe Zahara Benet, an immigrant from homophobic Cameroon, first winner on iconic LGBTQ+ reality show RuPaul's Drag Race, and legendary artist celebrating Queer Black Excellence today. The film follows BeBe's remarkable journey with unprecedented access: A portrait of an artist who chooses to live a creative life against all odds.

programme.title: Are You Proud?
programme.desc: Are You Proud? is a vivid and engaging docu-celebration of the LGBT rights movement from the partial victory of the 1967 Sexual Offences Act to Stonewall, the Gay Liberation Front, the AIDS crisis, Legal Marriage and finally the 2016 Pulse night club shooting. The film gives an extensive history of the course of LGBT rights campaigning, and shows how much more work there is still to be done.

programme.title: Beyond Borders
programme.desc: A Salvadorian murder suspect and MS13 gang member is tracked down to the streets of NewJersey by officer Ken and his team. In Miami a woman is released back into her community with an ankle monitor while hercase is being processed by a federal judge. A Cuban businessman suspected of money laundering and narcotics distribution isapprehended in Tucson.

programme.title: Beyond Borders
programme.desc: Officer Ken and his team track down an illegal immigrant with convictions for DUI and domestic violence on the streets of Newark. A Mexican criminal who was released back into the community after serving time in prison is picked up in Philadelphia.

programme.title: Beyond Borders
programme.desc: A convicted drug dealer on the run is apprehend by officer Ryan. Officer Jamison runs into an activist in San Diego who spends his day tracking down ICE officers to make sure they are not breaking the law.

programme.title: Beyond Borders - Episode 1
programme.desc: Captures in gripping detail the high stakes game of cat and mouse played out every day across America between law enforcement and those regarded as foreign criminals evading justice. Revealing the real challenges beyond the US borders.

programme.title: Scam City
programme.desc: Buenos Aires' sultry climate attracts 10 million tourists a year. Host Conor Woodman sets out to discover the most common scams involving tourists: pickpocketing, clip joints, vice girls, and hotel scams. But the worst is all the counterfeit money.

programme.title: Scam City
programme.desc: Istanbul is one of the world's most exotic cities, a place where Europe and Asia collide. This exotic blend of cultures is both fascinating and disorienting -- a perfect environment for the skillful scammer to target vulnerable tourists.

programme.title: Scam City
programme.desc: New Delhi is one of the world's greatest historical cities, but scratch beyond the surface and host Conor Woodman swiftly discovers a world of skillful hustlers, conmen and scammers, all doing their best to relieve each and every tourist of their cash.

programme.title: Scam City
programme.desc: At night in Prague, scammers emerge, readying themselves for the tourists enjoying the city's nightlife. The tourists are unaware that they've already been marked by those disguised as beautiful girls, harmless hawkers, and friendly taxi drivers.

programme.title: Scam City
programme.desc: Host Conor Woodman is in Rio de Janeiro. Every year, millions of tourists descend on this Brazilian city for the biggest party in the world - Carnival. And with so many tourists out reveling on the streets it's party time for Rio's scammers too.

programme.title: Scam City
programme.desc: In Morocco, host Conor Woodman enters the city of Marrakech, where nothing is what it seems. He navigates through the Jamaa El Fna, the largest square in Africa, dodging Gnawa dancers and snake charmers who take your money before you know what's happening

programme.title: Scam City
programme.desc: Host Conor Woodman is in Rome, on a mission to uncover the gritty underworld that crawls under its thriving tourist scene. There's a turf war between Rome's thieves and con men, in which tourists have become both the spectators and the prize.

programme.title: Scam City
programme.desc: Host Conor Woodman visits the pickpocket capital, Barcelona, one of the most popular tourist destinations in the world. But this city has a dark secret: some of the most skilled con men and thieves in the world.

programme.title: Scam City
programme.desc: Host Conor Woodman ventures to Las Vegas, a city with a seedy underbelly of sex and swindlers. Beyond Vegas's bright neon lights and swanky casinos, there's more to the city than meets the eye.

programme.title: Scam City
programme.desc: Host Conor Woodman is in Bangkok, Thailand, one of the hottest cities on earth. It has been 15 years since his last visit, this time to see if the gem scam he first encountered there is still being run – and to discover another one.

programme.title: Scam City
programme.desc: In New Orleans Conor becomes victim to culturally bespoke scams unique to this city. He starts by experiencing street level scammers …the small fry that feed off the Mardi Gras Street Carnival.

programme.title: Scam City
programme.desc: Conor Woodman discovers the paradox that is Mexico City. From the moment he takes a taxi from the airport he is on a mission to find out about the kidnapping scam of the city’s taxis.

programme.title: Scam City
programme.desc: Conor Woodman immerses himself in the Big Apple and find outs that Zero Tolerance hasn’t swept tourist scams from the streets. He’s taken for a ride by unlicensed pedi-cab touts in Central Park, discovers where pickpockets ply their trade now they’ve been shifted from Time Square, and falls into a huge and dangerous counterfeit perfume scam.

programme.title: Scam City
programme.desc: In the holy city of Jerusalem, scam artists have been perfecting their craft for thousands of years. From fake holy men at the Western Wall, to pickpockets on the Mount of Olives, Conor uncovers the dark truth about the sacred sites of the holy city.

programme.title: Scam City
programme.desc: In Mumbai Conor Woodman experiences the mother of all taxi scams minutes after his arrival from the airport. After a gruelling experience at the hands of a relentless scamster claiming to be a travel agent, Conor is then approached by a woman who says she can make him a Bollywood star.

programme.title: Scam City
programme.desc: As daylight fades, the scammers emerge from the shadows readying themselves for a nights work in one of Europe's most popular tourist destinations, Amsterdam. Conor meets the city's hustlers, pickpockets, fake police and ATM skimming gangs.

programme.title: Scam City
programme.desc: Conor Woodman goes undercover in his home town of London to discover a whole new side to the city. After getting his phone snatched, using tracking software Conor goes in pursuit of the culprits to retrieve his property.

programme.title: Scam City
programme.desc: Hong Kong, a place where nothing is what it seems and Conor’s journey takes him from the heart of Hong Kong island to the border with Mainland China. Conor goes shopping for antiques and is sold an expensive jug from the Ming dynasty, only to find out that it wasn’t exactly what he thought it was.

programme.title: Scam City
programme.desc: Conor Woodman searches for a deadly zombie drug that renders its victims helpless as he explores the underside of Colombia's largest city.

programme.title: Scam City

programme.title: Libya – The Ancient Chariots Of Libya
programme.desc: The vast desert country veiled from the East by fear, prejudice and misunderstanding. Adams follows in the wheel tracks of Ancient Rome's 'chariots of fire'.

programme.title: Ethiopia – Keepers Of The Lost Ark
programme.desc: David Adams makes the pilgrimage from Lalibela to Gondar in Ethiopia to find the Ark of the Covenant.

programme.title: How To Save A Tribe
programme.desc: The Samaritans are one of the most ancient tribes in the world - they’ve been around for over 3,000 years. But the population is now fragile and the tribe at risk of finally dying out...

programme.title: Episode 6
programme.desc: The final challenge takes the celebrities back to the Iron Age to experience life in 43AD. Greg and Meg are elected as the group's tribal chiefs and have two days to prepare a Celtic feast.

programme.title: Secrets From The Ice
programme.desc: The climate is changing and the mysterious stories of ancient humans are melting out of the ice.

programme.title: Made in Senegal
programme.desc: Made in Senegal is a story about will, dreams, determination, faith, rebellion, courage and love. The film invites us on a journey through Sadio´s different and highly diverse worlds - from the rural life in a small village in the far south of Senegal to the spotlight of world football by playing for Liverpool FC, even winning the Champions Leagues as number 10 with the world watching… The interaction of animations, documentary scenes, a diverse set of in-depth interviews and archive footage brings Sadio´s past to life and creates an exciting and emotional plot.

programme.title: Champions
programme.desc: Wendie Renard, seven-time UEFA champion and FIFA Women's Player of the Year in 2018, awaits the arrival of Annie Fortems, a pioneer of French women's football, and Sonia Ouchene, a promising young player from Stade de Reims, at the Olympique Lyonnais stadium. Wendie recalls the start of her career, her victories and difficult moments including racist attacks. Annie reveals how her generation brought women's football into the French mainstream, despite receiving death threats, while Sonia speaks freely about the gender pay gap between women's and men's football. The meeting of the three is resplendent with mutual admiration.

programme.title: Rumeysa: Walking Tall
programme.desc: Standing tall at 215.6 cm (7 ft 0.7 in), Rumeysa Gelgi's striking stature is matched only by her extraordinary inner strength. Born with the rare genetic mutation Weaver's Syndrome, life has not been easy for the world's tallest woman. Now, thanks to life-changing surgery, she's ready to travel to the USA for the first time and meet some of the world's most inspiring women. On this journey of self discovery, Rumeysa will share her story and learn from other incredible Guinness World Record title holders.

programme.title: Ona Carbonell: Starting Over
programme.desc: In August 2020, Olympic artistic swimmer Ona Carbonell became a first time mother, an experience that reshaped her life overnight. At the same time, Ona embarked on an ambitious plan to compete at the Tokyo Olympics. The documentary follows Ona during these intense 11 months, where she must push the limits to extraordinary degrees both physically and emotionally. Up close to Ona, we share her everyday routines and challenges, from breastfeeding and playing with baby Kai to the intense training sessions with the National Spanish Team.

programme.title: SEVE - Artist, Fighter, Legend
programme.desc: Seve Ballesteros was an artist, a golfing Picasso. He was a fighter; against back injury, rivals on the golf course, a disintegrating swing, and finally cancer. He remains a legend, a multi-major champion and the man who made the modern Ryder Cup. This is his story, from members of his inner circle, other sporting greats and from himself via newly unearthed material.

programme.title: One Man and His Shoes
programme.desc: One Man and His Shoes' tells the story of the phenomenon of Air Jordan sneakers showing their social, cultural and racial significance and how ground-breaking marketing strategies created a multi-billion-dollar business.

programme.title: The Witness
programme.desc: Bill Genovese investigates the 1964 murder of his sister Kitty Genovese, a New York woman who was attacked while 38 bystanders allegedly did nothing to help her.

programme.title: Discovering Canary Islands - Episodes 5-6
programme.desc: Episode 5 - La Palma | Episode 6 - El Hierro and La Gomera

programme.title: Rumeysa: Walking Tall
programme.desc: Standing tall at 215.6 cm (7 ft 0.7 in), Rumeysa Gelgi's striking stature is matched only by her extraordinary inner strength. Born with the rare genetic mutation Weaver's Syndrome, life has not been easy for the world's tallest woman. Now, thanks to life-changing surgery, she's ready to travel to the USA for the first time and meet some of the world's most inspiring women. On this journey of self discovery, Rumeysa will share her story and learn from other incredible Guinness World Record title holders.

programme.title: Barcelona: Surf Destination
programme.desc: In "Barcelona: Surf Destination", Ítalo Ferreira, the first Olympic surf champion, travels to Barcelona at the invitation of his friend Alex Vilalta to explore the waves of the Catalan coastline and meet the community of surfers that keep the spirit of the sport alive in this Mediterranean hub. In this sun-soaked adventure documentary, we are invited to join a holiday with friends, who reunite to shoot the breeze and to do what they love the most: surf.

programme.title: Champions
programme.desc: Carolina Morace, in Rome, reveals herself as a woman of character, unafraid to be the first woman in any feat, such as the first to score four goals at Wembley Stadium. We meet Barbara Bonansea, Juventus player elected FIFA FIFPro Women's World 11 2020, with her family including her grandmother, who supported her in her desire to be a footballer. US Sassuolo youngster Benedetta Orsi talks optimistically about how she overcame the illness that forced her to give up tennis but gave her the opportunity to develop her passion for football.

programme.title: Lauda: The Untold Story
programme.desc: In 1976 Niki Lauda survived one of the most famous crashes in Formula One history. Using previously unseen footage, Lauda: The Untold Story explains what happened on that fateful, and near fatal day at the Nurburgring, then follows Lauda’s courageous journey to recovery culminating in a miraculous comeback in Monza just weeks later. The film also investigates the impact that his crash had not just on his own life but on the sport as a whole, looking at the safety developments from the 1900s to the present day.

programme.title: Andrés Iniesta, The Unexpected Hero
programme.desc: This is the story of a normal person who does extraordinary things. Someone who pursues and achieves triumphs through taking care of the small details, because these are, after all, the ones that make him a different soccer player. We all know the Iniesta-magician of the ball, who conquered two triplets with Barça and raised the World Champion Cup with the Spanish National Team. And yes, of course we know their great sporting moments. But who is behind this global sport superstar? Through exceptional witnesses such as Leo Messi, Neymar Jr., Pep Guardiola, Sergio Ramos, Luis Enrique and a long etc.

programme.title: Ride Your Dream
programme.desc: Motorcycling was a man’s world, until now. This documentary introduces us to Ana Carrasco, the Spanish rider who has revolutionised the two wheels’ world and who, from an early age, had a clear dream: being world champion. Through intimate conversations with her family and team, we get to know Ana’s motivations, the obstacles she has faced and the dreams she keeps chasing. Her career, from its origins in a small town in Murcia to being the first woman to win the World Championship, is a source of inspiration for anyone. Ana herself is a clear example of overcoming struggle and tenacity, and her story which is full of exciting moments encourages us all to fight for our dreams.

programme.title: Champions
programme.desc: Three-time Olympic medallist and 2012 FIFA World Women's Coach of the Year Pia Sundhage recalls her reaction at being called up to join the Swedish women's national team. Speaking to Stina Blackstenius, FIFA Women's World Cup Bronze Medal and two Olympic Games Silver Medal winner, and Molly Johansson, both players for BK Häcken, Pia explains her belief that football gave her a way of life. She relates the feelings she had when she took part in the Olympic Games, and how playing in France made her stronger, while Molly shares her goals for the future.

programme.title: My Decision, by Andrés Iniesta
programme.desc: “Very few people know what happened when I got injured. Few know that I had to make a momentous decision. Was it worth it to keep playing or was it time to call it quits?” The revealing documentary follows the legendary midfielder, Andrés Iniesta, as he faces a crucial decision after a career-threatening injury. A tale of a lifelong love affair with football, under threat by a cruel inevitability.

programme.title: Episodes 7-8
programme.desc: The 18-Day Storm | A New Beginning

programme.title: Karate-do: The Path of Sandra Sánchez
programme.desc: She is not a dragon, though in the dojo you'd swear otherwise. This is Sandra Sánchez, and she's going down in history as one of the greatest karate has ever seen. This is the story of her unique path. Her 'Do'. A winding story of playing at karate as a child, to navigating an abusive relationship as an adult, and concluding in her unbelieveable and record-smashing penultimate year competing in the three most prestigious karate championships, and winning all three. Success is never an easy path, but at the Tokyo Olympics Sandra fought for - and against - many struggles, as she claimed her place in history.

programme.title: Champions
programme.desc: Bundesliga winner and AC Milan player Julia Simic travels from Nuremberg to pick up Dafina Redzepi (TSG Hoffenheim) and visit Bärbel Wohlleben, who has the honour of being the first woman to have scored an ARD Sportschau Goal of the Month. Julia shows us the football camp she has set up to train in a new generation of young women, while Bärbel recalls her childhood years and how the German football federation (DFB) banned women from playing professional football. The three play on the banks of the Rhine talking about their shared passion for the sport.

programme.title: Made in Senegal

The documentary follows Ona during these intense 11 months, where she must push the limits to extraordinary degrees both physically and emotionally. Up close to Ona, we share her everyday routines and challenges, from breastfeeding and playing with baby Kai to the intense training sessions with the National Spanish Team.

programme.title: America From Above
programme.desc: Part one of a new series of ambient drone films for relaxation, America From Above is a spectacular yet ultra-soothing 1-hour long natural journey that sweeps viewers gently above America's vistas. You'll begin the farmlands of Iowa, soaring west through the Rocky Mountains of Colorado, then on to Utah's iconic red rock landscapes and finally ending on the West Coast with a familiar voyage over Big Sur and then back to San Diego just in time for sunset.

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher: Curtains for Dennis
programme.desc: Mum has bought curtain material for the soon to be newly decorated kitchen, and asks Dad to look after it while she is out. However, Dad falls asleep and mistakenly agrees that Dennis can use it as a giant sail. When Dad realises that it has gone, he calls Dennis to bring it back, but unfortunately Dennis gets into a spot of bother with the colonel, who takes the curtain material off Dennis. In an attempt to steal it back, the garden being wrecked and the kitchen is left looking like a bombsite. Dennis, Gnasher and Dad have to clean up the whole kitchen and redecorate it in time for Mum returning. When Mum decides it is time to hang the new curtains, Dennis is about to get the curtain...

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher: Lost
programme.desc: Dennis, his friends and Walter's friends get marooned on a desert island when Dennis attempts to escape a boring field trip. Followed by Substitute Creecher

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher: Dennis Jumps the Line
programme.desc: Dennis plays a prank on the citizens of Beanotown, causing them to evacuate, which causes trouble for Dennis later. Followed by 'No Place Like Home'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher: Double Act
programme.desc: Gnasher and Gnipper enter a dog show, regardless of Walter saying they don't have true talent. He wants Athena and Miss Mini Wuff to win, but Walter has just underestimated Gnasher's true capabilities. Followed by Grounded.

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher: The In Crowd
programme.desc: Athena gets Gnasher envy when seeing a pampered version of Gnasher in a magazine and when she hears that Dennis owns an Abyssinian wire-haired tripe hound (Gnasher), she wants him. However, being an owner to Gnasher isn't all cracked up to be! Followed by 'Splash'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher: Dennis Hiccups
programme.desc: Dennis gets a case of the hiccups from Mr. Har Har's can-o-giggles and is looking for a way to cure them ready for a film premier. Followed by Athena's Party

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher: Beanotown in Bloom
programme.desc: The garden is accidentaly wrecked when Dennis tries to give Gnasher a bath, so the gang have to fix the mess before Mum comes home. Followed by 'Run Rabbit Run'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher: You're Joking
programme.desc: Dennis makes a line of practical jokes for Mr. Scrimp, called 'The Menace Collection.' However, Dennis soon learns that it will put Mr. Har Har out of business.

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher: The Way of Den-Do
programme.desc: After Walter takes up origami as a martial art, Dennis scoffs and comes up with his own martial art, and so the two prepare to battle it out. Followed by 'Smelling of Roses'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher: Aliens Among Us
programme.desc: After watching a film about an alien invasion, Dennis, Curly and Pie Face decide to make their own film. However, Walter stumbles across them filming, and he only sees the action, not the camera. Filming what he sees on his mobile phone, he runs to tell the whole of Beanotown about the alien invasion. As panic spreads, Dennis and his friends discover the chaos and decide to keep filming in order to help make the best of their own alien film. Meanwhile, Sergeant Slipper investigates the alien landing that Walter has seen, and discovers the truth—that the spaceship is a playhouse with glow sticks in it. Followed by 'Castle in the Air'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher: Great Outdoors
programme.desc: Dennis and his pet dog, Gnasher, live by just one rule: Kids should make all the rules! Followed by Dance of the Seven Pies.

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher: Game On
programme.desc: To get his friends back from Walter's group, Dennis challenges Walter to a videogames battle. Followed by 'Fish Tale'.

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher: Attack of the Walterbot
programme.desc: For a school project, Dennis and Walter both build robots. However, during an accident, both robots merge, causing Dennis and Walter to defend the school. Followed by 'No Joke.'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher: Dennis V.I.P
programme.desc: With one backstage pass for a Ratbucket gig, Dennis and his friends pass themselves off as Ratbucket, only for the real Ratbucket not to be able to play at his own concert. Followed by 60 second Dennis and 'Bad Dad'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher: Rubber Bands and Paperclips
programme.desc: After Dennis breaks his bike, Dad is unable to afford a new one, so Dennis convinces him to ask his boss for a raise. Unfortunately, Mr Scrimp reduces his wages instead. Dennis then trashes his house to convince Scrimp that his family are poor, so that Mr Scrimp will feel compelled to raise Dad's wages. Just as Scrimp has been taken in by Dennis' plan, Mum and Dad arrive home laden with shopping bags, resulting in Dad getting fired on the spot. Dennis resolves to get Dad his old job back by secretly causing chaos at his office. To restore order Scrimp rehires Dad, sealing the deal with a generous pay rise. Mum and Dad repair the house, but still don't have enough money to buy Dennis a new...

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher: Breakout
programme.desc: Believing Gnasher and Gnipper to be trapped in Beanotown Dog Pound, Dennis comes up with a plan to rescue his friends and bring them both home. Followed by more Dennis and Gnasher episodes.

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher: Eyes on the Prize
programme.desc: When Dennis breaks his skateboard again, Dad agrees to buy Dennis the best skateboard there is as a replacement if he is able to win a prize at the upcoming school award ceremony. Followed by 60 Second Dennis and 'Dance of the Seven Pies'

programme.desc: Dennis tries to get a birthday present by saying thank you to his relatives. However, because of Dennis' naughty personality, they take his attempts in a negative way. Followed by 'Dennis Hiccups'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher: Game On
programme.desc: To get his friends back from Walter's group, Dennis challenges Walter to a videogames battle. Followed by 60 Second Dennis and 'Masters of the House'.

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher: All-In Menacing
programme.desc: After a wrestling accident, Gnasher swallows a canister of laughing gas at the vet's. Dennis, along with Gnasher hide in the conference centre, where dad gives a speech. However, the canister leaks, causing Gnasher to fart laughing gas and having everyone laughing. Followed by 'Attack of the Walterbot'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher: No Pies for Pie face
programme.desc: Dennis and Co. have to control Pie Face's obsession with pies during the Pie Festival. Otherwise, they will be grounded. Followed by 'Great Outdoors'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher: Dig This
programme.desc: On a school trip, Dennis finds out that he is descentant to a warrior tribe. He also discovers that Montanna Smith (a famous Indiana Jones-esque explorer and one of Walter's personal heroes) is actually a thief who's trying to steal the treasure of Dennis' ancestor. Will he be stopped before he gets his hands on the treasure? Followed by Dog Tired.

programme.desc: Athena gets Gnasher envy when seeing a pampered version of Gnasher in a magazine and when she hears that Dennis owns an Abyssinian wire-haired tripe hound (Gnasher), she wants him. However, being an owner to Gnasher isn't all cracked up to be! Followed by 'Splash'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher: Dennis Hiccups
programme.desc: Dennis gets a case of the hiccups from Mr. Har Har's can-o-giggles and is looking for a way to cure them ready for a film premier. Followed by Athena's Party

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher: Beanotown in Bloom
programme.desc: The garden is accidentaly wrecked when Dennis tries to give Gnasher a bath, so the gang have to fix the mess before Mum comes home. Followed by 'Run Rabbit Run'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher: You're Joking
programme.desc: Dennis makes a line of practical jokes for Mr. Scrimp, called 'The Menace Collection.' However, Dennis soon learns that it will put Mr. Har Har out of business.

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher: The Way of Den-Do
programme.desc: After Walter takes up origami as a martial art, Dennis scoffs and comes up with his own martial art, and so the two prepare to battle it out. Followed by 'Smelling of Roses'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher: Aliens Among Us
programme.desc: After watching a film about an alien invasion, Dennis, Curly and Pie Face decide to make their own film. However, Walter stumbles across them filming, and he only sees the action, not the camera. Filming what he sees on his mobile phone, he runs to tell the whole of Beanotown about the alien invasion. As panic spreads, Dennis and his friends discover the chaos and decide to keep filming in order to help make the best of their own alien film. Meanwhile, Sergeant Slipper investigates the alien landing that Walter has seen, and discovers the truth—that the spaceship is a playhouse with glow sticks in it. Followed by 'Castle in the Air'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher: Great Outdoors
programme.desc: Dennis and his pet dog, Gnasher, live by just one rule: Kids should make all the rules! Followed by Dance of the Seven Pies.

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher: Game On
programme.desc: To get his friends back from Walter's group, Dennis challenges Walter to a videogames battle. Followed by 'Fish Tale'.

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher: Attack of the Walterbot
programme.desc: For a school project, Dennis and Walter both build robots. However, during an accident, both robots merge, causing Dennis and Walter to defend the school. Followed by 'No Joke.'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher: Dennis V.I.P
programme.desc: With one backstage pass for a Ratbucket gig, Dennis and his friends pass themselves off as Ratbucket, only for the real Ratbucket not to be able to play at his own concert. Followed by 60 second Dennis and 'Bad Dad'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher: Rubber Bands and Paperclips
programme.desc: After Dennis breaks his bike, Dad is unable to afford a new one, so Dennis convinces him to ask his boss for a raise. Unfortunately, Mr Scrimp reduces his wages instead. Dennis then trashes his house to convince Scrimp that his family are poor, so that Mr Scrimp will feel compelled to raise Dad's wages. Just as Scrimp has been taken in by Dennis' plan, Mum and Dad arrive home laden with shopping bags, resulting in Dad getting fired on the spot. Dennis resolves to get Dad his old job back by secretly causing chaos at his office. To restore order Scrimp rehires Dad, sealing the deal with a generous pay rise. Mum and Dad repair the house, but still don't have enough money to buy Dennis a new...

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher: Breakout
programme.desc: Believing Gnasher and Gnipper to be trapped in Beanotown Dog Pound, Dennis comes up with a plan to rescue his friends and bring them both home. Followed by more Dennis and Gnasher episodes.

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher: Eyes on the Prize
programme.desc: When Dennis breaks his skateboard again, Dad agrees to buy Dennis the best skateboard there is as a replacement if he is able to win a prize at the upcoming school award ceremony. Followed by 60 Second Dennis and 'Dance of the Seven Pies'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher: Thank-You's
programme.desc: Dennis tries to get a birthday present by saying thank you to his relatives. However, because of Dennis' naughty personality, they take his attempts in a negative way. Followed by 'Dennis Hiccups'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher: Game On
programme.desc: To get his friends back from Walter's group, Dennis challenges Walter to a videogames battle. Followed by 60 Second Dennis and 'Masters of the House'.

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher: All-In Menacing
programme.desc: After a wrestling accident, Gnasher swallows a canister of laughing gas at the vet's. Dennis, along with Gnasher hide in the conference centre, where dad gives a speech. However, the canister leaks, causing Gnasher to fart laughing gas and having everyone laughing. Followed by 'Attack of the Walterbot'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher: No Pies for Pie face
programme.desc: Dennis and Co. have to control Pie Face's obsession with pies during the Pie Festival. Otherwise, they will be grounded. Followed by 'Great Outdoors'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher: Dig This
programme.desc: On a school trip, Dennis finds out that he is descentant to a warrior tribe. He also discovers that Montanna Smith (a famous Indiana Jones-esque explorer and one of Walter's personal heroes) is actually a thief who's trying to steal the treasure of Dennis' ancestor. Will he be stopped before he gets his hands on the treasure? Followed by Dog Tired.

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher: Curtains for Dennis
programme.desc: Mum has bought curtain material for the soon to be newly decorated kitchen, and asks Dad to look after it while she is out. However, Dad falls asleep and mistakenly agrees that Dennis can use it as a giant sail. When Dad realises that it has gone, he calls Dennis to bring it back, but unfortunately Dennis gets into a spot of bother with the colonel, who takes the curtain material off Dennis. In an attempt to steal it back, the garden being wrecked and the kitchen is left looking like a bombsite. Dennis, Gnasher and Dad have to clean up the whole kitchen and redecorate it in time for Mum returning. When Mum decides it is time to hang the new curtains, Dennis is about to get the curtain...

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher: Lost
programme.desc: Dennis, his friends and Walter's friends get marooned on a desert island when Dennis attempts to escape a boring field trip. Followed by Substitute Creecher

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher: Dennis Jumps the Line
programme.desc: Dennis plays a prank on the citizens of Beanotown, causing them to evacuate, which causes trouble for Dennis later. Followed by 'No Place Like Home'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher: Double Act
programme.desc: Gnasher and Gnipper enter a dog show, regardless of Walter saying they don't have true talent. He wants Athena and Miss Mini Wuff to win, but Walter has just underestimated Gnasher's true capabilities. Followed by Grounded.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies watch some children dancing while King Pleasure and the Biscuit Boys play 'See Saw Majory Daw'. Po has fun going up and down the slide. The Lion and Bear appear in Teletubbyland.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 Painting with Hands & Feet
programme.desc: Teletubbies love dancing, but they love children even more. So everything stops when they watch some children painting in a most unusual way. Back at the house, a trail leads Tinky Winky all around Teletubbyland to find out – Who Spilled the Tubby Custard?

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies watch Daniel and Stephanie make big round pancakes. They are having a round and round day. They run round and round in Teletubbyland, but they stop to see the dancing bear in the Carousel, then there's time for one more dance.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies watch some children taking photographs of each other's faces. Dipsy has a good look around Teletubbyland when a telescope appears.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies watch some girls spend the day picking and sorting vegetables in their nannies garden. Tinky Winky sets the table for Tubby Toast, but when he calls the other Tubbies, Noo-Noo tidies it all up. Po makes some more and the Teletubbies eat it very quickly/

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: A cloud appears in Teletubbyland. The Teletubbies watch some children playing in the rain. Dipsy steps in a puddle. Three magic ships sail through Teletubbyland.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: Dipsy goes for a walk and sees lots of things in Teletubbyland. The Teletubbies watch as Andy Brown shows some children a rockpool. There's time for one more dance before Tubby Bye Bye.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: Noo-Noo tidies up Laa-Laa's ball. The Teletubbies watch some children rolling things up…and down a hill. Po starts all the other Teletubbies rolling through Teletubbyland.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies watch three boys fill a sand pendulum and make a picture. Tinky Winky, Dipsy and Laa-Laa follow Po everywhere. The animals march through Teletubbyland, before it is time for Tubby Bye-Bye.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies watch Andy Brown and some children go digging in the sand for worms. Laa-Laa and Po decide to share the scooter.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies watch Thomas and Jack having fun playing on the beach and building sandcastles. In Teletubbyland the Teletubbies are going round and round.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.sub-title: S03 : E54 Sarah, Fraser & the Ducks
programme.desc: A voice trumpet brings a message for the Teletubbies. The Teletubbies watch some children feeding the ducks. Po finds a new trick to play with Tubby Toast. Three ships sail through Teletubbyland.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies watch some children dancing while King Pleasure and the Biscuit Boys play 'See Saw Majory Daw'. Po has fun going up and down the slide. The Lion and Bear appear in Teletubbyland.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: A voice trumpet brings a message that makes Laa-Laa laugh. The Teletubbies watch some children learning about the number one. The Teletubbies take turns to wear the skirt.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: A voice trumpet brings a message for Dipsy and Laa-Laa. The Teletubbies watch some children learn about the number two.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: Three Teletubbies dance through Teletubbyland. The Teletubbies watch some children learn about the number three. Dipsy climbs a steep hill.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies watch some children learn about the number four. They have fun singing a song of four before it's time for Tubby Bye-Bye.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies dance through Teletubbyland. The Teletubbies watch some children learn about the number five.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies love playing "Boo!" The Teletubbies watch some children learn about the number six. Tinky Winky, Dipsy and Laa-Laa get their knees dirty and have fun getting them clean.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies watch some children learn about number eight. Eight clouds appear in Teletubbyland and the Teletubbies learn count to eight. The animals march through Teletubbyland.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies pop up to say hello before they gather round to watch some children learn about the number nine. Po and Tinky Winky count nine flowers that appear in Teletubbyland and then run off to fin Dipsy and Laa-Laa and dance the Bump dance.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: Teletubbies love to dance, but they love children even more. So everything stops when the Teletubbies watch a film all about a little boy's special friend: a pig call Winnie. There's time for Tubby Custard before the Tubby Bye Bye.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: Dipsy and Laa-Laa go for a walk and have fun saying hello to Tinky Winky and Po. The Teletubbies watch Alex Pascall share the story of the 'Owl Babies' with some children.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: It's time for Dipsy to have some Tubby Toast. The Teletubbies watch some children have fun in their paddling pool on a sunny day.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: Teletubbies lobe to play peek-a-boo. The Teletubbies watch some children painting pictures. When a book appears in Teletubbyland, something magic happens when Dipsy turns the pages.

programme.desc: A voice trumpet brings a message that makes Laa-Laa laugh. The Teletubbies watch some children learning about the number one. The Teletubbies take turns to wear the skirt.

programme.title: 30 Soft Rock Classics of the 70s!
programme.desc: Soft Rock, sometimes known as Yacht Rock, was a thing back in the 70s! Proper laid back sunny songs & plenty of smooth West Coast vibes - and we're not talking Cornwall here!

programme.title: Weekend Rock Anthems
programme.desc: Your weekend anthems and the biggest rock songs from the last 50 years! From the Beatles and the Stones in the 60s right through to One Republic and Kings Of Leon in the 10s.

programme.title: The 70s Rock Jukebox!
programme.desc: Put another dime in the jukebox as we crank the volume up to 11! These are 25 sing out loud 70s rock anthems, including Queen, T.Rex, Alice Cooper & Led Zeppelin.

programme.title: Nicky Horne's Best Of British!
programme.desc: Nicky Horne's definitive 30 best British rock tracks ever from across the decades. Featuring Kate Bush, The Manics, Motorhead but who is the very best of British?

programme.title: The Best Of British!
programme.desc: Born in blighty, this is the best of british rock! From Black Sabbath, Bowie & Deep Purple to Queen, Pink Floyd & The Sex Pistols.

programme.title: American Rock Gods! 1970-1979
programme.desc: In order telling the rock story of a decade - 2 hours of Aerosmith, Springsteen, Alice Cooper, The Ramones, Kiss, Blondie & Iggy Pop.

programme.title: The 80s Rocked!
programme.desc: Non-stop 80s rock! From Queen, Bon Jovi & Whitesnake to Meat Loaf, Bonnie Tyler & Tina Turner.

programme.title: Forgotten Riffs of Rock n Roll!

programme.title: 50 Biggest Rock Anthems!
programme.desc: Over 4 hours of non-stop the biggest, timeless anthems! Featuring legendary acts like AC/DC, Jimi Hendrix, & Queen, through to Linkin Park, Razorlight & Fall Out Boy.

programme.title: Rock No.1s
programme.desc: Number 1 rock songs from the last 50 years! From the Beatles and the Stones in the 60s right through to One Republic and Kings Of Leon in the 10s.

programme.title: Kid Jensen's 70s Guitar Riffs
programme.desc: Rock, Pop, Punk & New Wave...across them all, a great chunky guitar riff made these 25 handpicked gems hard to beat. From our sister channel NOW 70s, Kid Jensen cranks it up to 11!

programme.title: Aerosmith Vs U2

programme.title: 21st Century Rocks!
programme.desc: The 21st Centuries finest selection of Rock songs! From The Kaiser Chiefs, Green Day & The Killers to Linkin Park, Nickelback & Evanescence. This is Now Rock!

programme.title: Rick Wakeman's 70s Rock Down
programme.desc: Producer, keyboardist, presenter, prog rock god, and grumpy man extraordinaire Rick Wakeman presets the ultimate 70s Rock Down - from Free to Kiss via The Who & Fleetwood Mac.

programme.title: 70s Rock Anthems!
programme.desc: All 70s rock! From T Rex, Deep Purple & Queen to Pink Floyd, Suzie Quatro & The Rolling Stones. This is NOW Rock!

programme.title: Rock's First Ladies 1965-2023

programme.title: Simon Bates Golden Hour: 1979
programme.desc: 60 minutes of hits & headlines from the year of 'Moonraker', 'Alien' & 'The Muppet Movie' and when 24 million people saw Penelope Keith in 'To The Manor Born' on TV.

programme.title: Simon Bates NEW Golden Hour: 1978
programme.desc: Another 60 minutes of hits & headlines from the penultimate year of the decade when Anna Ford became ITV's first ever female news reader and the TV licence fee climbed to Â£25!

programme.title: Simon Bates Golden Hour: 1977
programme.desc: 60 minutes of hits & headlines from the year Demis Roussos soundtracked 'Abigail's Party', Punk was the new scourge of society, but it was outsold by TV cop crooner David Soul!

programme.title: Simon Bates Golden Hour: 1976
programme.desc: 60 minutes of hits & headlines from the year Concorde, the Bionic Woman, The Honey Monster & Rentaghost all launched! And it was one of the hottest summers on record.

programme.title: Simon Bates Golden Hour: 1975
programme.desc: 60 minutes of hits & headlines from the year Margaret Thatcher became Tory leader, 'Ding A Dong" won Eurovision, and Fawlty Towers opened its doors for the very first time!

programme.title: Simon Bates Golden Hour: 1974
programme.desc: 60 minutes of hits & headlines from the year TV's Ronnie Barker started receiving Porridge in Slade Prison, and the band Slade topped the album chart - twice!

programme.title: Simon Bates NEW Golden Hour: 1973
programme.desc: Another 60 minutes of hits & headlines served with a side or order of flares! It was a busy year for the Queen as she opened the Sydney Opera House & the new London Bridge.

programme.title: Simon Bates Golden Hour: 1972
programme.desc: 60 minutes of hits & headlines from a year of major cultural debuts - 'Jesus Christ Superstar', 'Are You Being Served?' & George, Zippy & Bungle in 'Rainbow'!

programme.title: Simon Bates Golden Hour: 1971
programme.desc: 60 minutes of hits & headlines from the year Gary Barlow, David Tennant & Clare Balding were born. And the UK said goodbye to pounds, shillings & pence as we went decimal!

programme.title: Simon Bates NEW Golden Hour: 1970
programme.desc: Another 60 minutes of hits & headlines from a year of firsts - 18 year olds were allowed to vote in the UK, Hawaii Five-O arrived on the TV & the 747 Jumbo launched from Heathrow!

programme.title: 70s v 80s Mixtape!
programme.desc: 60 hit songs, 30 top artists - one track as they were in the 70s, and another in the 80s - simple! From Abba to Slade, Kate Bush to Blondie and Billy Joel to Billy Ocean.

programme.title: Art School Cool! 1970-79
programme.desc: Art-school innovators, cool mavericks and risk-taking heroes all combine in this heady two-hour mix of stars who often pushed music way beyond the confines of chart-based pop.

programme.title: USA Through Film Full Stitch_16x9_FC
programme.desc: Actor and director Jordan Spiro (Ozark, Night Comes On) spent childhood vacations with her family in New Orleans. For Spiro, the city’s heritage as the birthplace of jazz is reflected in its mélange of arts and food culture that always feels fresh, inviting, and joyous, even after a lifetime of visits. “There’s this ‘all senses on overload’ side to New Orleans that takes my breath away every time.”

programme.title: Wild Travels
programme.sub-title: S02 : E02 Gatorland - Muhammad Ali Collection - West Virginia State Penitentiary - Randyland
programme.desc: Will tries and fails to ride an alligator at Orlando’s Gatorland; drops in on the only used car dealership with a priceless collection of Muhammad Ali memorabilia in New Hampshire; dabbles in the paranormal at the abandoned and haunted West Virginia State Penitentiary; and then meets an outrageous artist who is creating a psychedelic city block in Pittsburgh known as “Randyland.”

programme.title: Wild Travels
programme.sub-title: S02 : E01 Ben & Jerry’s Flavor Graveyard - Mermaid Show - Cog Railray - Sneaker Convention - Bug Art Collection
programme.desc: Will finds himself in the middle of an ice cream catastrophe at Ben & Jerry’s Factory in Waterbury, Vermont; mingles with mermaids at the underwater show in Weeki Wachee, Florida; achieves speeds of 5 miles per hour on the cog wheel train to the summit of Mt. Washington, New Hampshire; buys new kicks at a Sneaker convention in Cleveland; and marvels at Bug Art portraits at a museum in St. Johnsbury, Vermont.

programme.title: Venturing Out: Park 2 Park
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 Grand Junction: Lightspeed Heavy Lift
programme.desc: Near Colorado National Monument, Raheim teaches amateur weightlifter Jaime how to leverage her strength on the Millennium Falcon, a red sandstone overhang. In Rabbit Valley, they rip through epic desert trails on off-road vehicles.

programme.title: Venturing Out: Park 2 Park
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 Grand Junction: From Dusk 'till Dawn
programme.desc: At Lunch Loops, Raheim keeps young actor Shaquille on his toes as they conquer switchbacks, rock gardens, and steep drops. They also SUP in the nearby Colorado River and dig into delicious local eats at Bin 707.

programme.title: Venturing Out: Park 2 Park
programme.sub-title: S01 : E07 Grand Junction: Bill’s Spill
programme.desc: In mile-high alpine forests near Grand Junction, Raheim encourages IT analyst Bill to get back on the bike following an accident that left him with multiple broken bones. They also ride ski lifts, kayak lakes of snowmelt, and sip lavender gin.

programme.title: Venturing Out: Park 2 Park
programme.sub-title: S01 : E08 Wilmington, Delaware: Surf's Up

programme.title: Epic Idaho
programme.desc: Photographer Chad Case and videographer Jonathan Conti take you on an epic adventure through Idaho.

programme.title: Amplify
programme.desc: Singer/songwriter Summer Dean visits her college stomping grounds and discovers it offers more music history than Buddy Holly. Punk rock drummer Phanie Diaz checks out local art in San Antonio and rapper Lou Charles.

programme.title: Amplify
programme.desc: Lou hooks up with keyboardist Patric Johnston while Summer records an original song at a legendary recording studio. Phanie learns about the multicultural history of the accordion aka Texas squeezebox.

programme.title: Amplify
programme.desc: Phanie gets a lesson in the bajo sexto, a 12-stringed guitar, while Lou meets the owner of Houston’s independent record shop Vinal Edge. Summer tries her hand at graffiti art.

programme.title: Amplify
programme.desc: Summer jams with Nathen Rogers and his band, La Croix Boix. Lou gets a tour of Sugarhill Recording Studio and Phanie’s punk band plays alongside the accordion-powered Tex Mex band Piñata Protest.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: Philippe visits the Hawaiian Islands and explores their traditional methods of catching fish and collecting sea salt; dives off the coast of Maui and discovers sea creatures along the coral reef; and travels to Kauai and searches a limestone cave where ancient artifacts are preserved.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: Philippe visits the Grand Canyon in Arizona; explores Bryce Canyon in Utah and learns about its fascinating hoodoos; and dives into the Monterrey Bay in California and discovers an incredible underwater canyon that features unusual sea creatures.

programme.title: Venturing Out: Park 2 Park
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 Asheville: From Tubes to Tubing
programme.desc: In North Carolina’s Pisgah National Forest, outdoor enthusiast Raheim Robinson mentors novice Mariko as she navigates big climbs and steep drops. After checking out a record-pressing plant, they go tubing on the world’s third oldest river.

programme.title: Venturing Out: Park 2 Park

programme.title: California Pop

programme.title: Wild Travels

programme.desc: Will witnesses one of the first Beard & Mustache Competitions where women have their own category (the "Whiskerinas"); enjoys America’s oldest Mardi Gras celebration in Mobile; takes on the 150 ton tower of debris at the Cathedral of Junk in Austin; marvels at the mammoth collection of war memorabilia at Dragonman’s Military Museum; and then watches an unusual breed of fainting goats topple over at a farm in Alabama.

programme.title: Wild Travels
programme.sub-title: S03 : E03 Movie Madness Videos - Dino Hotel - Tug Fest - World's Largest Truck Stop - Mooning Amtrak
programme.desc: Will surveys cinematic oddities at Movie Madness Videos in Portland; checks in to the Dino Hotel in Colorado so he can check out their impressive collection of dinosaur fossils; drops in on Tug Fest, the incredible tug-of-war between two towns on opposite sides of the Mississippi River; discovers some of the surprising array of amenities at the World's Largest Truck Stop in Iowa; and sneaks a peek at a California bar’s annual tradition of mooning passing Amtrak trains.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives

programme.title: 6 Billion people to Feed - Part 2
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Earth from above - Season 2 - 6 Billion people to Feed - Part 2
programme.desc: Yann Arthus-Bertrand continues his world tour in the name of sustainable development and environmental protection. He shows us the incredible wealth of our planet and goes to meet those who propose solutions to perpetuate farming and cultivation models. We discover how to feed ourselves without destroying in the Rhône-Alpes region, how to preserve the forest in Indonesia, but also the extent of GMOs in Alsace as well as the advantages of terroir in Provence-Alpes-Côte-D'azur.

programme.title: Do wild animals still exist ? - Part 1
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Earth from above - Season 2 - Do wild animals still exist ? - Part 1

There, women and men manage to protect wildlife every day.

programme.title: The Essential
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Fresh Yoga - Season 3 - The Essential
programme.desc: Supreme happiness does not come from having it or from outer success but from the embodiment of our inner being. This inner being then gives us access to futile pleasure, pleasant experience, the very consequence of the embodiment of inner happiness. Our philosophy reveals aspirations, desires, while letting go of superficial needs. The return to our essence allows us to become aware of what we really need and not to waste time with what is inessential to us. This session gives us the opportunity to anchor ourselves in the essence, by feeling our balance and reactivating it. Perched in the trees, Katy was inspired by the force of the simplicity of Nature to create standing postures,...

programme.title: Violaine Courtois
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen People - Season 2 - Violaine Courtois
programme.desc: Everything started from the dream of her parents, she becomes a veterinarian. In her career that she launched backwards, Violaine will meet people who will take her to a different path of life. The chance will be at the rendezvous but it is especially the courage to resume studies and create his company that will build his project. Follow the encounters and travels of Violaine that brought her to fasciatherapy and nonviolent communication.

programme.title: Zoe Boivin
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen People - Season 2 - Zoe Boivin
programme.desc: To know how to listen, it can take a long time as it can happen in a revelation. It's a real revelation that led Zoe to listen to herself, to hear a destiny that dedicated her to an artistic career. From her studio to a vernissage, from her family to a workshop given in a school, share Zoe's adventure to the path that truly corresponds to her.

programme.title: Do wild animals still exist ? - Part 2
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Earth from above - Season 2 - Do wild animals still exist ? - Part 2
programme.desc: Yann Arthus-Bertrand surprises us with preserved landscapes. And sometimes even with vast spaces where man's imprint remains invisible. Yann Arthus-Bertrand continues his world tour in favour of the protection of the environment and wildlife. From the tip of the African continent, he decides to take down the fences to let the animals roam freely, then he takes us to Cambodia to see if the tigers will disappear. Then we head to London to follow the chimpanzee or to France to study and save the bees.

programme.title: Cambodia, Shinta Mani Wild
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Reset - Season 1 - Cambodia, Shinta Mani Wild
programme.desc: In this episode of Reset, dive into the world of Shinta Mani Wild. This exceptional place lost in the Cambodian jungle was born from the inspiration of a landscape architect with a passion for nature. This unique refuge combines hospitality and environmental conservation in the heart of the Cardamom forest. Come and enjoy an experience of relaxation, in the midst of luxuriant nature, inviting you to step out of your comfort zone. Here, we are also helping to preserve the natural world around us, recognising that our well-being is linked to its preservation.

programme.title: Hotel Paseo, Palm Springs
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen Trendy - Season 2 - Hotel Paseo, Palm Springs
programme.desc: Val takes us to discover Palm Springs, the trendy and designer city in the heart of the California desert. In the heart of a private collection, we will discover all the flora of this region: an outdoor plant museum, one of the largest collections of cacti, and even tequila flowers. Then we'll head to the Paséo Hotel, one of the zen and design hotels of Palm Springs, where we'll meet the chef of the restaurant who will concoct his signature dishes. We will end our day with a relaxing massage with crystals.

programme.title: How to install a plant in the garden
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My First Garden - Season 1 - How to install a plant in the garden
programme.desc: Today, we're meeting in the market garden of Romainville to learn how to install a plant in the garden. In our last episode, we saw how to plant a small seed to make it germinate and give a plant, it’s called a "seedling". To go faster, you can also buy or collect small plants that you will install in your garden. That's what we'll see today.

programme.title: The Dance of Life
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Fresh Yoga - Season 3 - The Dance of Life
programme.desc: An eternal restart. Every second that passes is a new opportunity to be even happier. At the end of this trip, Katy leaves with a lot of new experiences and teachings, imprints (samskaras) that no one can take away from her. The awakening that she acquired through her personal experience, implemented in her practice allows her to engrave the “lessons" which the Universe offers us in her heart at any moment. Daily life and habits make us lose our sense of the passage of time, so lets use our intelligence to realize that we are alive and that each second remains a new opportunity to live better, revealing our eternal dance and our loving heart. Let your being move to the rhythm of this...

programme.title: David Jeannerot
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen People - Season 2 - David Jeannerot
programme.desc: David Jeannerot left the world of fashion and abandoned his career as artistic director to become a plant. An exceptional florist who wishes to give back all its place to nature in the city.David had a dream life. He traveled around the world for major ready-to-wear brands. But under the appearance David was actually very isolated. To give meaning to his life, and to go in the direction of his personal convictions, he decides to become a plantist. He arranges corners of greenery on the smallest window sill with the aim of bringing nature to the city, and to make Paris greener.

programme.title: Leah
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen People - Season 3 - Leah
programme.desc: Working 12 hours a day in the tech industry, Leah was living a fast paced high-life that only looked good on paper. Frequently ill and constantly exhausted, she experienced a burn out and decided to tackle meditation. What came next was a radical change in lifestyle that resulted in a move to Bali, The Island of the Gods. Today she sees her career blossom as she enjoys sharing her meditation knowledge with the world.

programme.title: So the great rivers may live - Part 1
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Earth from above - Season 2 - So the great rivers may live - Part 1
programme.desc: Water and its beauty, water and its power, water and its fragility... the water we all need is becoming scarce, through our own fault. Some rivers are dry, others are diverted, cut off by dams, others are simply polluted, and this for decades. We will discover how humans transformed the nature in Argentina, then in China and its disproportionate Three Gorges Dam. We will also go in Botswana with the Okavango, this unique river which flows into a desert forming the famous Okavango Delta. Vu du Ciel makes you discover once again another world, magnificent but threatened.

programme.title: The Maharajas
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Let me capture your world - Season 1 - The Maharajas
programme.desc: Nicolas Henry is a photographer who travels around the world, discovering countries and their peoples. With them, he recreates symbolic scenes of their own history and captures them in photographs. When he goes back to India, he delves into a fascinating myth: the one of the Maharajas. Who are the descendants of these ancient rulers? On his way to Gujarat and Rajasthan, he will meet three families descended from the Maharajas, who agreed to open their doors.

programme.title: Caspar David Friedrich & Wagner - Old heroes graves
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Masters & Composers - Caspar David Friedrich & Wagner - Old heroes graves
programme.desc: The series Masters & Composers invites you to discover a painter and a composer on short episodes to discover the beauty and the precision of their works. You will admire a painting while listening to a different composition in each episode. The combination of these two arts will immerse you into the Beaux-Arts and you will discover the masterpieces of Fragonard, Cezanne, Friedrich or Boucher and the compositions of Mozart, Tchaikovsky, Wagner or Handel.

programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Masters & Composers - Ingres & Schumann - Francis I
programme.desc: The series Masters & Composers invites you to discover a painter and a composer on short episodes to discover the beauty and the precision of their works. The combination of these two arts will immerse you into the Beaux-Arts and you will discover the masterpieces of Fragonard, Cezanne, Friedrich or Boucher and the compositions of Mozart, Tchaikovsky, Wagner or Handel.

programme.title: Zodiacal Tablets
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Art investigation - Season 1 - Zodiacal Tablets
programme.desc: The Grand Zodiacal tablets have intrigued Gallo-Roman specialists since they were discovered at the bottom of a well in a small village in the Vosges 50 years ago. These two small ivory tablets, which are almost 2000 years old, represent an enigmatic sky map: in the centre, the sun and the moon, and all around, the signs of the Zodiac. A second circle represents the decans in the form of small Egyptian characters... Another enigma: the tablets were found by archaeologists broken into hundreds of small pieces.... So why were they destroyed? We conducted an investigation from the Epinal Museum, where the Grand tablets are kept, to Egypt, via the Louvre Museum.

programme.title: Turner at the Tate Britain
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Within the frame - Season 1 - Turner at the Tate Britain
programme.desc: Joseph Mallord William Turner was one the greatest landscape artists of the 19th century. Atypical and avant-garde, he created his own highly personal style, which earned him the title of “the Painter of Light”, so close was he to perfection in the art of evoking atmosphere. In this collection you will find his famous seascapes and scenes of Venice and England. In “The Garreteer’s Petition” you will also see that Turner was more than just a brilliant landscape painter… Enjoy your visit!

programme.title: Dulwich Picture Gallery
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Within the frame - Season 1 - Dulwich Picture Gallery
programme.desc: Dulwich Picture Gallery has a collection with extraordinary origins! In 1790, the King of Poland commissioned two London art dealers. They bought paintings all over Europe, which remained in their possession after the fall of Poland. They left the collection to Dulwich College and, following their request, the first public art gallery in England opened its doors in 1817. Here you will find masterpieces by artists such as Poussin, Rembrandt and Murillo. Enjoy your visit!

programme.title: The still-lif
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Sketchbook - Season 1 - The still-lif
programme.desc: Raphael Federici (street artist), Marine Goodmorning (illustrator), Luca Fiore (cartoonist) and Harry Boudchicha (drawing teacher) reveal their best drawing techniques. Each episode focuses on a specific subject:movement, oil painting, shadows, hair... For the first 10 minutes, each artist gives a theoretical lesson illustrated by sketches. Then they each start working on their creation. Finally, they end with a debrief, comparingand explaining their techniques

programme.title: Alain Godon
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Artist's Workshop - Season 1 - Alain Godon
programme.desc: In this episode, we meet the artist Alain Godon. From the shores of France to the English countryside, from parachutist to nightclub manager, Alain Godon has had a thousand and one lives. But he has always remained a painter. He is a figurative painter with a naive and cheerful pencil stroke, who, far from fashions, trends and museum fads, is acclaimed by many collectors for whom he works from his workshop in Waltham in Kent.

programme.title: Annette Messager
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Artist's Workshop - Season 1 - Annette Messager
programme.desc: In this episode, we will meet the artist Annette Messager. Her creations have been shaking up the contemporary scene for almost 50 years. She is one of the greatest French artists, awarded a Golden Lion at the Venice Biennale in 2005. She uses fabric and everyday objects to represent the intimate. But she also remains a committed artist. Installed in the popular suburbs of Paris, Annette Messager welcomes us in her workshop.

programme.title: Fernand Léger, his political and artistic commitment
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Art News - Season - Fernand Léger, his political and artistic commitment
programme.desc: A direct and comprehensible art for all, such was the desire of Fernand Léger, the politically committed painter wanted to reconcile the modern aesthetic with popular themes.

programme.title: Fernand Leger Metz
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Art News - Season - Fernand Leger Metz
programme.desc: In the urban landscape of the twentieth century, on the construction sites of large buildings but also on the circus ring, in art, poetry or political commitment, beauty is everywhere.

programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Art News - Season - Artist's studio : Gérard Schlosser

programme.title: Crossed interviews, Afriques Capitales
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Art News - Season - Crossed interviews, Afriques Capitales
programme.desc: Lille and the Gare Saint Sauveur have inspired this exhibition and this journey to Simon Njami. lille3000 presents about thirty contemporary artists from fifteen African countries, from the Maghreb to South Africa, who will reveal this continent in full reinvention, young and creative. This exhibition invites visitors to a journey, whether spiritual, poetic, political, artistic, real or committed.

programme.title: Musée Marmottan-Monet
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Museum stories - Season 1 - Musée Marmottan-Monet
programme.desc: Throughout the first half of the 20th century, the Marmottan Museum was a center of First Empire art. We go there to admire the magnificent collection of Paul Marmottan, and to relive the nostalgia of the great Napoleonic era, its imperial splendor, its past glories. But little by little, the Marmottan Museum is becoming a showcase for another style of art, less classic, more avant-garde: impressionism. In 1993, the museum changed its name: it became the Musée Marmottan-Monet.

programme.title: Auguste Rodin
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Within the frame - Season 1 - Auguste Rodin
programme.desc: Auguste Rodin (1840 - 1917) was one of the most important French sculptors of the 19th century. He is considered to be one of the fathers of modern sculpture.

programme.title: Spencer Tunick
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 The decisive moment - Season 2 - Spencer Tunick
programme.desc: In this episode, we will discuss with Spencer Tunick, an American visual photographer. He is known for his photographic compositions featuring hundreds of volunteers, men and women, posing nude, mostly in urban settings. He does not define himself as a photographer, but as a creator of installations, the photos being only the representation of his works.

programme.title: Cheryl Dunn
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 The decisive moment - Season 2 - Cheryl Dunn
programme.desc: In this episode, we meet Cheryl Dunn, photographer. After moving to New York City in the mid-1980s, she spent much of her career photographing the city's streets and the people who made their mark on them. In the late 1990s, she began to focus on film, creating classic films about artists of her generation who influenced the realities of urban life through their own work.

programme.title: The Closerie Falbala - In the eye of Jean Dubuffet
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Museum Tour - Season 1 - The Closerie Falbala - In the eye of Jean Dubuffet
programme.desc: Jean Dubuffet is a theoretician of Art brut and the most contested and known French artist of the post-war period. In 1969 he decided to build a place for his Cabinet Logologique and at his own expense. This assembly, called La Closerie Falbala, is a pure creation of the mind. This construction site will be considerable, it’s a real artistic and technical challenge. This monumental work is today one of the "youngest" historical monuments in France.

programme.title: Fine arts
programme.desc: "It's not quite nature, it's a statue. The feeling of greatness, I put it there. But it still makes work easier, when nature gives you almost everything.” from Aristide Maillol. This quote perfectly sums up Maillol's artistic approach, his first ambitious figure, Méditerranée (1905), appears as the manifesto of the "return to order" of which he is a major actor in sculpture. This documentary film wants to tell the man and his art, this quest for perfection which will push him from painting to tapestry, from tapestry to sculpture, always with the ambition of revisiting an art.

programme.title: Gustav Klimt & Egon Schiele
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 The World's Greatest Painters - Season 1 - Gustav Klimt & Egon Schiele
programme.desc: Gustav Klimt, a Vienna Secession leader and an Austrian painter, was one of the first painters to spread the Art nouveau in the Austro-Hungarien empire. He received the gold medal of merit from the Austria Emperor for his work and also painted one of the most expensive portrait in the world. Egon Schiele is also an Austrian painter and one of the founder of the artistic group “Neukunstgruppe”, influenced by the works of Van Gogh or Toulouse-Lautrec. His friendship with Klimt helped him in his work to develop hiw own style by drawing characters and tortured bodies. His works are considered “grotesque, erotic, pornographic or disturbing”.

programme.title: The Rococo
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Within the frame - Season 1 - The Rococo
programme.desc: Through some works of Fragonard, Boucher, Watteau (among others), here is the rococo current whose works go back to the end of the XVIIIth century. The theme of the fêtes galantes also evokes the fact that the setbacks of love are inseparable from its pleasures.

programme.title: Basel
programme.desc: Today, Travelers takes you to Basel, Switzerland, a city renowned for its culture and art. We'll start by visiting the old town, one of the most beautiful and best preserved in Europe. We will look for one of the 180 fountains in the city and visit the Tinquely Museum. We will go to the Congress Palace and see the Roche Tower, the largest tower in Switzerland.

programme.title: Hatsushika Hokusai
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Art News - Season - Hatsushika Hokusai
programme.desc: Landscape stands in Japan is a very old art that begins around 1830s, this art finds its apogee with the artist Hatsushika HOKUSAI.

programme.desc: And if video games were to enter our museums one day, this is the challenge that the EDF Foundation has taken up by opening its doors to the Game exhibition.

programme.title: Frankfurt - Germany
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 The World's Greatest Painting Museums - Season 1 - Frankfurt - Germany
programme.desc: A business and transit city located in the heart of Germany, Frankfurt combines the charm of a medieval city with its half-timbered houses, with the dynamism of contemporary modernism with its forest of skyscrapers. We are going to visit the Städel Museum which offers an exceptional journey through seven centuries of Western art, from the end of the Middle Ages to the present day. The neo-classical portrait of Goethe, the most famous of German writers, painted by Tischbein the Younger in 1787, then revised by Andy Warhol in 1982, are two iconic paintings exhibited in this museum.

programme.title: The Slanted Look - Robert Doisneau
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Art investigation - Season 1 - The Slanted Look - Robert Doisneau
programme.desc: Robert Doisneau's "The Slanted Look" was born in 1948 on the rue de Seine in Paris. The man who described himself as a "poacher of the ephemeral" used a technique that he was particularly fond of, the "affût". This work is part of the series called "Romi's Window", which hides several mysteries. We investigate the life of this man, undoubtedly the most prolific of his generation, one of those post-war "makers" of images who were not yet called "photographers". A look back at this period, when Doisneau was not yet the star of the still image.

programme.title: Slam
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 The decisive moment - Season 1 - Slam
programme.desc: In this episode, we will meet Slam, a portrait photographer. He lives between Paris and New-York, and he is a photographer specialized in beauty, music, fashion, he makes portraits sometimes provocative. He will tell us about his life, his career, and how he became a photographer.

programme.title: Giles Clarke
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 The decisive moment - Season 2 - Giles Clarke
programme.desc: In this episode, we will meet Giles Clarke, photojournalist. He has covered many areas of conflict and humanitarian crisis. He will tell us about the dangers of his work, the difficulties it presents, his motivations, and his views on the world around us and its crises.

programme.title: Maja Bajevic
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Art News - Season - Maja Bajevic
programme.desc: Maja Bajevic, finalist for the 2017 Marcel Duchamp Prize presents her art installation on the theme of utopia.

programme.desc: He's a rare artist in France. The painter and sculptor Manolo Valdés is exhibiting at the Galerie Opéra in Paris, and gallery director Gilles Dyan has been keen to show the Spanish artist for years.

Be it in an alternative school close to Leh or in a monastery perched on a rocky outcrop, he captures the reality of these students, monks, farmers... and he recreates symbolic scenes of their history.

programme.title: Maurice Utrillo & Suzanne Valadon
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 The World's Greatest Painters - Season 1 - Maurice Utrillo & Suzanne Valadon
programme.desc: The world of modern painting is full of human stories that are off the beaten track. Suzanne Valadon's story is a perfect example. The daughter of a laundress and an unknown father, this woman, before becoming a painter, was the muse and model of the greatest masters of Impressionism who worked in Montmartre district of Paris. Suzanne Valadon painted still lifes, bouquets and landscapes remarkable for the strength of their composition and their vibrant colours. She is also known for her nudes painting. Maurice Utrillo, Suzanne’s son, began to paint regularly from 1910 and made a living from his painting. He produced hundreds of paintings over several decades. Representative painter of the...

programme.title: Serge Poliakoff
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Within the frame - Season 1 - Serge Poliakoff
programme.desc: Serge Poliakoff's compositions may seem very simple at first sight, like puzzles of coloured shapes, but when you look at them closely, they reveal great richness. The painter works on the plasticity of forms. For example, in the painting "Composition 1950", he focuses on the middle of the canvas with small forms where white and yellow attract the eye and rejects around the larger figures with the sharp contours and less sharp tones.
